message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.SD, cs.IR 

This paper is about a spoken dialogue system that uses reinforcement learning to optimize its dialogue strategy. The paper discusses the use of Q-learning and the PARADISE evaluation framework to train the system. Based on this, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also involves the use of artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, which makes cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. The system is designed for human-computer interaction (HCI), which suggests cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) as another possible sub-category. The system is used for accessing email, which could fall under cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing) or cs.IR (Information Retrieval), depending on the focus of the paper.
